thread.title: #CNNFood challenge: What's cooking in your kitchen?
thread.title_full: #CNNFood challenge: What's cooking in your kitchen?

title: #CNNFood challenge: What's cooking in your kitchen?
text:
CNN Leadership
#CNNFood challenge: What's cooking in your kitchen? By Sophie Eastaugh, for CNN Updated 1809 GMT (0109 HKT) October 2, 2015 Story highlights Share your typical breakfast, lunch and dinner on social media Tag it #CNNFood and you could be featured on CNN.com This story complements the Culinary Journeys TV series, airing monthly on CNN International. See more of the show here: www.cnn.com/journeys . Share photos of your own Culinary Journeys on Instagram with the hashtag #CNNFood for a chance to be featured on CNN. (CNN) They say breakfast is the most important meal of the day, but its size and makeup varies enormously around the world. Over in Norway, you may be tucking into a slice of Norvegia cheese on toasted bread , while in Lebanon you might opt for creamy fatteh -- a dip made with chickpeas, yogurt and pine nuts. And that doesn't even cover lunch or dinner. With those, you've got a whole other host of opportunities. Culinary Journeys wants to see what a typical breakfast, lunch and dinner consists of where you are in the world. A video posted by CNN Travel (@cnntravel) on Oct 2, 2015 at 6:31am PDT Send us pictures and videos of your three daily meals on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram or Vine, tagging #CNNFood . Make sure to tell us where you are and what you're eating -- you could be featured on CNN.com. So get eating -- and snapping!
